SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.lonepulse.robozombie.util
Class Fields

java.lang.Object
  com.lonepulse.robozombie.util.Fields
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Field>
public final class Fields
extends Object
implements Iterable<Field>

Fluent filtering for a collection of Fields.

Note that two Fields are determined to be equal of and only if they were declared in the same Class, using the same name and type.

Since:
1.3.0

Version:
1.1.0

Author:
Lahiru Sahan Jayasinghe

Nested Class Summary
static interface Fields.Criterion
          This contract defines a strategy for filtering the Fields within an instance of Fields by evaluating each Field to determine if it should be included in the filtered result.

Method Detail

in

public static Fields in(Object target)

Creates a new instance of Fields from the given object by extracting all its member Fields.

See Object.getClass() and Class.getDeclaredFields().

Parameters:
target - the object whose fields are to extracted

Returns:
a new instance of Fields for the Fields on the given object

Since:
1.3.0

public Fields named(String fieldName)

Filters the Fields whose name equals (case-sensitive) the given name and returns a new instance of Fields that wrap the filtered collection.

Parameters:

difference

public Fields difference(Fields fields)

Finds the difference between this instance and a supplied instance. Returns a new instance of Fields with only those Fields which unique to this instance.

 Difference can be expressed as, 
 
 A - B = { x ∈ A and x ∉ B }
  
 where,
 
 A = this Fields instance
 B = supplied Fields instance
 x = any field from the resulting Fields instance

Parameters:
fields - the instance of Fields whose common items are subtracted from this instance

Returns:
a new instance of Fields which wraps only the only those Fields which are unique to this instance

Since:
1.3.0

union

public Fields union(Fields fields)

Finds the union between this instance and a supplied instance. Returns a new instance of Fields which contains a set of all the Fields which in both this instance and the supplied instance.

 Union can be expressed as, 
 
 A ∪ B = { x : x ∈ A or x ∈ B }
  
 where,
 
 A = this Fields instance
 B = supplied Fields instance
 x = any field from the resulting Fields instance

Parameters:
fields - the instance of Fields whose Fields are added to this instance

Returns:
a new instance of Fields which wraps all the unique Fields in this instance and the given instance

Since:
1.3.0

intersection

public Fields intersection(Fields fields)

Finds the intersection between this instance and a supplied instance. Returns a new instance of Fields which contains all the Fields common to both instances. 

 Intersection can be expressed as, 
 
 A ∩ B = { x : x ∈ A and x ∈ B }
  
 where,
 
 A = this Fields instance
 B = supplied Fields instance
 x = any field from the resulting Fields instance

Parameters:
fields - the instance of Fields whose common items are discovered

Returns:
a new instance of Fields which wraps only the only those Fields which are common between this instance and the passed instance

Since:
1.3.0

matching

public Fields matching(Fields.Criterion criterion)

Filters the Fields which match the given Fields.Criterion and returns a new instance of Fields that wrap the filtered collection.

Parameters:
criterion - the Fields.Criterion whose evaluation determines the filtered field

Returns:
a new instance of Fields which wraps the filtered Fields

Since:
1.3.0

iterator

public Iterator<Field> iterator()

Allows the Fields envelopped by this instance of Fields to be traversed sequentially using the returned Iterator.

Note this Iterator does not allow the underlying Fields to be modified, for example using Iterator.remove(). Doing so will result in an UnsupportedOperationException.

Specified by:
iterator in interface Iterable<Field>
Returns:
the iterator which allows the enclosed Fields to traversed sequentially

Since:
1.3.0
